private_information: I may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time; move only the top disk of any peg; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target configuration by moving only my allowed disks while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and the other agent's capabilities

private_information: I may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O
I must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time; move only the top disk of any peg; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively achieve the target configuration by moving only my allowed disks while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and the other agent's capabilities

private_information: I coordinate agents, resolve conflicts, integrate constraints, and output the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' constraints and produce a correct, solvable PDDL (domain and problem) for the FastDownward solver, along with an ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the target configuration

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency, enforce Tower of Hanoi legality, and disallow bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit tokens, quotas, or post-hoc penalties
I flag any attempt to move non-top disks or to place larger disks on smaller ones, and I ensure agent move permissions are respected
consistency_auditor.goal: Validate that proposed decompositions and move sequences are temporally and causally consistent and adhere strictly to the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent capability constraints

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right
Fifteen disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest)
Agent permissions: agent_1 may move A..H, agent_2 may move I..O
Initial configuration: left has A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O (top to bottom); middle empty; right empty
Goal configuration: left has B,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O (top to bottom); middle has A,D (top to bottom); right has C,E (top to bottom)
Rules: move one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg can be moved; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk E from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk C from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
notes: All moves respect Tower of Hanoi constraints and agent capabilities
Only agent_1 acts because all moved disks are within A..E; agent_2 remains idle as I..O never move

context.system_prompt: You are agent_1, responsible for disks A..H in a Tower of Hanoi task; you propose local strategies, decomposition into subgoals, and key constraints you will respect; do not emit PDDL; keep your output concise and strictly factual
context.prompt: Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private capabilities: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. State init and goal: initial {environment->init->initial_stacks} and goal {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Provide a compact summary of constraints you must enforce, useful local invariants and blocking conditions (e.g., required emptiness or ordering to place D then A on middle, and E then C on right), and a candidate decomposition that minimizes disturbance of large disks.

context.system_prompt: You are agent_2, responsible for disks I..O in a Tower of Hanoi task; you provide coordination constraints and non-interference commitments with respect to small-disk operations; do not emit PDDL; keep your output concise and strictly factual
context.prompt: Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private capabilities: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. State init and goal: initial {environment->init->initial_stacks} and goal {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Describe how you will avoid moving your disks unless strictly required, list conditions under which moving large disks would be necessary, and specify handoff boundaries with agent_1.

audit.system_prompt: You are the consistency auditor; you check for temporal and causal consistency, confirm adherence to Tower of Hanoi legality, and prohibit any bookkeeping shortcuts (tokens, quotas, post-hoc penalties); you do not emit PDDL
audit.prompt: Review the contexts from agent_1 and agent_2. Ensure all constraints respect single-disk moves, top-of-peg constraint, and no larger-on-smaller placements; verify agent capability partitions A..H vs I..O; identify any potential conflicts, ambiguous naming, or illegal intermediate placements; output a concise list of validated constraints and any required corrections.

synthesize.system_prompt: You are the multi-agent orchestrator; integrate inputs and produce a final and solvable PDDL domain and PDDL problem for the FastDownward solver; include only standard STRIPS-style PDDL with predicates for on, clear, smaller, top, peg, disk, agent permissions, and move action guarded by legality and capability constraints; ensure the problem encodes the exact initial and goal stacks; output the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem>; also output the ordered primitive move list enclosed in <moves></moves> using the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'
synthesize.prompt: Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Capabilities: {environment->init->agent_capabilities}. Initial: {environment->init->initial_stacks}. Goal: {environment->init->goal_stacks}. Target solver: {environment->init->target_solver}. Produce an integrated PDDL domain and problem that enforces agent-specific move permissions and Tower of Hanoi legality; ensure naming alignment for pegs and disks; after the PDDL, provide the full ordered move list inside <moves></moves> consistent with the PDDL and auditor-validated constraints.
